issue.title: Restart causes bitcoind 0.18 to re-validate whole blockchain history
issue.body:
I am playing around with [RaspiBolt](https://stadicus.github.io/RaspiBolt/) recently. Running Raspbian Buster with Raspberry Pi 3, bitcoind 0.18, LND 0.7.0-beta. It had catched up with the latest block height and everything was working, had some channels open with LND on mainnet. Then changed some bitcoin.conf settings and did `sudo systemctl restart bitcoind` and now `bitcoind` for some reason is re-validating whole blockchain from the block height 0 (which will take some month on that hardware). Bitcoin datadir is on external USB HDD, but that itself is kinda working without any issues.

```
maxmempool=50
maxconnections=40
maxuploadtarget=5000
```
Any ideas?

events.body:
This is the problem:
>#temp
reindex=1

That causes bitcoind to reindex every time you restart.
Ohh, damn, by bad! Dunno why it was there in the first place and why I didn't notice it.
